messages.messageBody:
--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:
>
> Me too. I'm glad this note was here, because I came to ask whether
> there are other videos of unschooling kids or families you think would
> be good to have in a central location. If they're out in public
> anyway, send a link.


Not sure if this is the type of movie you're thinking of, but these are my girls in a couple movies made by my husband. They worked on the story and storyboarding with him, and did all the acting. ; )

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QdWfRibp2Lg

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9oN3cFWTjCw

Ria

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Videos of Unschoolers (was Re: Interesting TV question)
messages.msgSnippet: Pam Genant just shared a video her 13 year made on facebook Its a claymation video. MD got a Flip camera video this Christmas and has his own youtube channel
messages.messageBody:
Pam Genant just shared a video her 13 year made on facebook
Its a claymation video.
MD got a Flip camera video this Christmas and has his own youtube channel where he uploads and does everything himself.
These are videos of a 7 year old that just got a camera.
You can probably see more of my messy house than anything else
His youtube channel is MegaSonicKing
Our family channel is Polykow

 
Alex Polikowsky
http://polykow.blogspot.com/

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/

messages.subject: Videos of Unschoolers (was Re: Interesting TV question)
messages.msgSnippet: -=I loved this video of Gigi the first time I saw it (a year ago?). I just smile through the entire thing!-=- Me too.  I m glad this note was here, because I
messages.messageBody:
-=I loved this video of Gigi the first time I saw it (a year ago?). I
just smile through the entire thing!-=-

Me too. I'm glad this note was here, because I came to ask whether
there are other videos of unschooling kids or families you think would
be good to have in a central location. If they're out in public
anyway, send a link. If you have a good one that's not in public and
you'd like for it to be, I could help you upload it if you don't have
a youtube account and don't want to have one, or if it's small I could
put it on my photobucket.

There was a blog with a video of a teenaged boy juggling and I got
permission to use it, but I've lost it. If anyone knows...

There was one of skateboarding, too. And there was one of some
surfing in San Diego...

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
